alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 10:53AM PST until December 31 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. For the High Surf Advisory, breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet with local sets to 15 feet, highest on west facing shores. Strong rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of sea water is possible around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A high tide of around 5.7 feet is expected between 1100 AM to 1115 AM today.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
